<minor/>\n      <comment>Cleaned up Beta Site Links</comment>\n      <text xml:space=\"preserve\" bytes=\"395\">{{Canyon\n|Coordinates=45.904333,-68.922\n|Location type=POI\n|Fastest typical time=9.5\n|Hike length=5.6\n|Region=Maine\n}}\n==Introduction==\n\n\n==Approach==\n\n\n==Descent==\n\n\n==Exit==\n\n\n==Red tape==\n\n\n==Beta sites==\n* [[File:rwl_en.png|alt=|link=]][http://brennen.caltech.edu/swhikes/katadn.htm Chris Brennen's Adventure Hikes (Southwest)]  : Katahdin; Maine\n\n==Trip reports and media==\n\n\n==Background==</text>\n      <sha1>9nhnmx3je9qvwu1ik9b7kvck6ynodg6</sha1>\n      <model>wikitext</model>\n      <format>text/x-wiki</format>\n    </revision>\n  </page>\n  <page>\n    <title>Screw Auger Falls Gorge</title>\n    <ns>0</ns>\n    <id>34280</id>\n    <revision>\n      <id>241092</id>\n      <parentid>241091</parentid>\n      <timestamp>2021-12-25T01:07:05Z</timestamp>\n      <contributor>\n        <username>Topshammaine1</username>\n        <id>2511</id>\n      </contributor>\n      <comment>/* Beta sites */</comment>\n      <text xml:space=\"preserve\" bytes=\"1369\">{{Canyon\n|Geolocation=Screw Auger Falls, Maine\n|Region=Maine\n|Technical rating=3\n|Water rating=C1\n|Time rating=I\n|Approach length=0.1 mi\n|Length=0.2 mi\n|Exit length=0.2 mi\n|Hike length=0.5 mi\n|Number of rappels=1\n|Longest rappel=25 ft\n|Permits=No\n|Best season=June to October\n|Explored=Yes\n|Rock type=Granite\n}}\n==Introduction==\n&quot;The last canyon along the Bear River in Grafton Notch is the Screw Auger Gorge. This \nshort Gorge is probably one of the most popular tourist destinations in the area. It is frequented \nby thousands of tourists each summer and it is not uncommon to find families and teens \nswimming here on a warm summer afternoon. The canyoneering opportunities are limited but \nstill possible. Rappel off a natural anchor or tree into the pothole below, escape the small \npothole and hike/ swim through the rest of the gorge.&quot;\n\nfrom ''The Maine Canyon Survey: A Guide to Canyoneering in Maine.''  \n\n[https://eyesupadventure.wixsite.com/adventure/maine-canyoneering]\n\n==Approach==\n\n\n==Descent==\n\n\n==Exit==\n\n\n==Red tape==\n\n\n==Beta sites==\n* [[File:rwl_en.png|alt=|link=]][http://summitpost.org/screw-auger-falls-gorge/826303 SummitPost.org]  : Screw Auger Falls Gorge]\n\n* [[File:rwl_en.png|alt=|link=]][https://eyesupadventure.wixsite.com/adventure/maine-canyoneering  Eyes Up Adventure]  : Maine canyoneering]\n\n==Trip reports and media==\n\n\n==Background==</text>\n      <sha1>ialzlgdrzmcg80dejtdh84801xf8dev</sha1>\n      <model>wikitext</model>\n      <format>text/x-wiki</format>\n    </revision>\n  </page>\n  <page>\n    <title>Inman's Cave</title>\n    <ns>0</ns>\n    <id>68718</id>\n    <revision>\n      <id>241096</id>\n      <parentid>241094</parentid>\n      <timestamp>2021-12-25T01:24:36Z</timestamp>\n      <contributor>\n        <username>Topshammaine1</username>\n        <id>2511</id>\n      </contributor>\n      <text xml:space=\"preserve\" bytes=\"773\">{{Canyon\n|CreatedBy=Topshammaine1\n|Coordinates=44.216476,-69.074684\n|Geolocation=Camden, maine\n|Region=Maine\n|Location type=Caving\n|Caving type=Cave\n|Technical rating=3\n|Water rating=A\n|Time rating=I\n|Number of rappels=2\n|Longest rappel=20 ft\n|Explored=Yes\n}}\n==Introduction==\nThis is one of the only caves in Maine that requires the use of SRT equipment. The cave is small but makes for a fun adventure. Location beta and more information can be provided by contacting the Maine Cave Survey with the following email: stephen.whitney1999@gmail.com\n\nIf you have visited this cave please do not post location data to keep riffraff out of dangrous situations!\n\n==Approach==\n\n\n==Descent==\n\n\n==Exit==\n\n\n==Red tape==\n\n\n==Beta sites==\n\n\n==Trip reports and media==\n\n\n==Background==</text>\n      <sha1>my83xaalpthe30j0ctdlbx6x3rzst5y</sha1>\n      <model>wikitext</model>\n      <format>text/x-wiki</format>\n    </revision>\n  </page>\n  <page>\n    <title>Bickford Slides Canyon</title>\n    <ns>0</ns>\n    <id>68720</id>\n    <revision>\n      <id>241099</id>\n      <parentid>241097</parentid>\n      <timestamp>2021-12-25T01:31:58Z</timestamp>\n      <contributor>\n        <username>Topshammaine1</username>\n        <id>2511</id>\n      </contributor>\n      <text xml:space=\"preserve\" bytes=\"1791\">{{Canyon\n|CreatedBy=Topshammaine1\n|Coordinates=44.27400, -70.98434\n|Region=Maine\n|Location type=Canyoneering\n|Technical rating=3\n|Water rating=C\n|Time rating=II\n|Number of rappels=3\n|Longest rappel=50 ft\n|Permits=No\n|Best season=June to October\n|Explored=Yes\n}}\n==Introduction==\nThis gorgeous canyon sits high up in the White Mountains of western Maine. The canyon \ndescends over 400 feet in just a half mile and requires technical gear for navigation around its \nfour rappels. It may be one of the most enjoyable descents in western Maine. Spend a fun \nmorning descending this canyon then hop on over to Rattlesnake Gorge for another fun descent.\n\n==Approach==\nThe best location to start from is the Brickett Place. There is a day use fee for this \ntrailhead it was $5.00 in 2021. From the \ntrailhead hike up Bickford Brook Trail past \nthe first trail intersection until you reach the \nsecond fork in the trail. (19 T 0341714E \n4904338N). Take the trail on the right at this \nintersection. The trail will cross over the \ncreek, follow this creek downstream until you \nreach the canyon.\n\n==Descent==\nWrap a tree and descend 30 ft into the \ncanyon. Continue down canyon until you \nreach the second drop. Wrap another tree and \ndescend 20 ft. Following the second rappel \nhike along the canyon avoiding the pools of \nwater as much as possible. Turn the corner \nand wrap another tree or boulder and descend \nto the large pool at the end of the canyon.\nHike along the stream another 1/4th of a mile \nto where a trail crosses the stream.\n\n==Exit==\nHike out to \nthe trail head on this trail or descend down \none last rappel on the other side of this trail.\n\n==Red tape==\n\n\n==Beta sites==\nhttps://eyesupadventure.wixsite.com/adventure/maine-canyoneering\n\n==Trip reports and media==\n\n\n==Background==</text>\n      <sha1>pk9cf6z42a0fs7t1dazr8s00sn5ybcb</sha1>\n      <model>wikitext</model>\n      <format>text/x-wiki</format>\n    </revision>\n  </page>\n  <page>\n    <title>The Cataracts</title>\n    <ns>0</ns>\n    <id>68931</id>\n    <revision>\n      <id>241469</id>\n      <timestamp>2022-01-04T18:38:04Z</timestamp>\n      <contributor>\n        <username>Topshammaine1</username>\n        <id>2511</id>\n      </contributor>\n      <comment>Created page with &quot;{{Canyon |CreatedBy=Topshammaine1 |AKA=Frye Brook Canyon, Cataracts Canyon |Coordinates=44.63512, -70.86156 |Region=Maine |Location type=Canyoneering |Technical rating=3 |Wate...&quot;</comment>\n      <text xml:space=\"preserve\" bytes=\"584\">{{Canyon\n|CreatedBy=Topshammaine1\n|AKA=Frye Brook Canyon, Cataracts Canyon\n|Coordinates=44.63512, -70.86156\n|Region=Maine\n|Location type=Canyoneering\n|Technical rating=3\n|Water rating=C\n|Time rating=II\n|Number of rappels=4-5\n|Longest rappel=50\n|Rock type=Granite\n}}\n==Introduction==\nNice Canyon near Andover, ME.\n\n==Approach==\nHike up trail to slot.\n\n==Descent==\n8ft rap into slot, 25ft two tier rap at the end of slot. Another 30 ft rap and a final 50ft.\n\n==Exit==\nHike out trail\n\n==Red tape==\n\n\n==Beta sites==\nSee The Maine Canyon Survey\n\n==Trip reports and media==\n\n\n==Background==</text>\n      <sha1>384dm0eovrtj4te9ppbkrrt0n0ajl6w</sha1>\n      <model>wikitext</model>\n      <format>text/x-wiki</format>\n    </revision>\n  </page>\n</mediawiki>\n"}}}
